drop table if exists asset_assignments cascade
drop table if exists assets cascade
drop table if exists categories cascade
drop table if exists maintenance_records cascade
drop table if exists refresh_tokens cascade
drop table if exists users cascade

create table asset_assignments (
        asset_id bigint not null,
        user_id bigint not null,
        primary key (asset_id, user_id)
    )

create table assets (
        next_maintenance date,
        purchase_date date,
        purchase_price numeric(10,2),
        warranty_expiry date,
        category_id bigint not null,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        asset_tag varchar(50) not null unique,
        brand varchar(100),
        location varchar(100),
        model varchar(100),
        name varchar(100) not null,
        serial_number varchar(100),
        vendor varchar(100),
        notes TEXT,
        description TEXT,
        condition enum ('BROKEN','EXCELLENT','FAIR','GOOD','POOR') not null,
        status enum ('ASSIGNED','AVAILABLE','DAMAGED','IN_MAINTENANCE','LOST','RETIRED') not null,
        primary key (id)
    )

create table categories (
        active boolean not null,
        sort_order integer,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        color_code varchar(50),
        icon varchar(50),
        name varchar(100) not null unique,
        description TEXT,
        primary key (id)
    )

create table maintenance_records (
        completed_date date,
        cost numeric(10,2),
        downtime_hours integer,
        maintenance_date date not null,
        next_maintenance_date date,
        asset_id bigint not null,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        created_by_user_id bigint,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        maintenance_type varchar(100) not null,
        performed_by varchar(100),
        vendor varchar(100),
        parts_used TEXT,
        description TEXT not null,
        notes TEXT,
        priority enum ('CRITICAL','HIGH','LOW','MEDIUM','URGENT') not null,
        status enum ('CANCELLED','COMPLETED','IN_PROGRESS','OVERDUE','SCHEDULED') not null,
        primary key (id)
    )

create table refresh_tokens (
        created_at timestamp(6) with time zone not null,
        expires_at timestamp(6) with time zone not null,
        revoked_at timestamp(6) with time zone,
        user_id bigint not null,
        id uuid not null,
        ip_address varchar(64),
        token_hash varchar(64) not null unique,
        replaced_by varchar(255),
        user_agent varchar(255),
        primary key (id)
    )

create table users (
        active boolean not null,
        must_change_password boolean not null,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        phone_number varchar(20),
        first_name varchar(50) not null,
        last_name varchar(50) not null,
        username varchar(50) not null unique,
        department varchar(100),
        job_title varchar(100),
        email varchar(255) not null unique,
        password varchar(255) not null,
        role enum ('IT_ADMIN','MANAGER','SUPER_ADMIN','USER') not null,
        primary key (id)
    )

create index idx_refresh_token_user 
       on refresh_tokens (user_id)

       add constraint FKbh3qpcc6um2ebd05n1y2iufgv 
       foreign key (user_id) 
       references users

create table asset_assignments (
        asset_id bigint not null,
        user_id bigint not null,
        primary key (asset_id, user_id)
    )

create table assets (
        next_maintenance date,
        purchase_date date,
        purchase_price numeric(10,2),
        warranty_expiry date,
        category_id bigint not null,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        asset_tag varchar(50) not null unique,
        brand varchar(100),
        location varchar(100),
        model varchar(100),
        name varchar(100) not null,
        serial_number varchar(100),
        vendor varchar(100),
        notes TEXT,
        description TEXT,
        condition enum ('BROKEN','EXCELLENT','FAIR','GOOD','POOR') not null,
        status enum ('ASSIGNED','AVAILABLE','DAMAGED','IN_MAINTENANCE','LOST','RETIRED') not null,
        primary key (id)
    )

create table categories (
        active boolean not null,
        sort_order integer,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        color_code varchar(50),
        icon varchar(50),
        name varchar(100) not null unique,
        description TEXT,
        primary key (id)
    )

create table maintenance_records (
        completed_date date,
        cost numeric(10,2),
        downtime_hours integer,
        maintenance_date date not null,
        next_maintenance_date date,
        asset_id bigint not null,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        created_by_user_id bigint,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        maintenance_type varchar(100) not null,
        performed_by varchar(100),
        vendor varchar(100),
        parts_used TEXT,
        description TEXT not null,
        notes TEXT,
        priority enum ('CRITICAL','HIGH','LOW','MEDIUM','URGENT') not null,
        status enum ('CANCELLED','COMPLETED','IN_PROGRESS','OVERDUE','SCHEDULED') not null,
        primary key (id)
    )

create table refresh_tokens (
        created_at timestamp(6) with time zone not null,
        expires_at timestamp(6) with time zone not null,
        revoked_at timestamp(6) with time zone,
        user_id bigint not null,
        id uuid not null,
        ip_address varchar(64),
        token_hash varchar(64) not null unique,
        replaced_by varchar(255),
        user_agent varchar(255),
        primary key (id)
    )

create table users (
        active boolean not null,
        must_change_password boolean not null,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        phone_number varchar(20),
        first_name varchar(50) not null,
        last_name varchar(50) not null,
        username varchar(50) not null unique,
        department varchar(100),
        job_title varchar(100),
        email varchar(255) not null unique,
        password varchar(255) not null,
        role enum ('IT_ADMIN','MANAGER','SUPER_ADMIN','USER') not null,
        primary key (id)
    )

drop table if exists asset_assignments cascade
drop table if exists assets cascade
drop table if exists categories cascade
drop table if exists maintenance_records cascade
drop table if exists refresh_tokens cascade
drop table if exists users cascade

create table asset_assignments (
        asset_id bigint not null,
        user_id bigint not null,
        primary key (asset_id, user_id)
    )

create table assets (
        next_maintenance date,
        purchase_date date,
        purchase_price numeric(10,2),
        warranty_expiry date,
        category_id bigint not null,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        asset_tag varchar(50) not null unique,
        brand varchar(100),
        location varchar(100),
        model varchar(100),
        name varchar(100) not null,
        serial_number varchar(100),
        vendor varchar(100),
        notes TEXT,
        description TEXT,
        condition enum ('BROKEN','EXCELLENT','FAIR','GOOD','POOR') not null,
        status enum ('ASSIGNED','AVAILABLE','DAMAGED','IN_MAINTENANCE','LOST','RETIRED') not null,
        primary key (id)
    )

create table categories (
        active boolean not null,
        sort_order integer,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        color_code varchar(50),
        icon varchar(50),
        name varchar(100) not null unique,
        description TEXT,
        primary key (id)
    )

create table maintenance_records (
        completed_date date,
        cost numeric(10,2),
        downtime_hours integer,
        maintenance_date date not null,
        next_maintenance_date date,
        asset_id bigint not null,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        created_by_user_id bigint,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        maintenance_type varchar(100) not null,
        performed_by varchar(100),
        vendor varchar(100),
        parts_used TEXT,
        description TEXT not null,
        notes TEXT,
        priority enum ('CRITICAL','HIGH','LOW','MEDIUM','URGENT') not null,
        status enum ('CANCELLED','COMPLETED','IN_PROGRESS','OVERDUE','SCHEDULED') not null,
        primary key (id)
    )

create table refresh_tokens (
        created_at timestamp(6) with time zone not null,
        expires_at timestamp(6) with time zone not null,
        revoked_at timestamp(6) with time zone,
        user_id bigint not null,
        id uuid not null,
        ip_address varchar(64),
        token_hash varchar(64) not null unique,
        replaced_by varchar(255),
        user_agent varchar(255),
        primary key (id)
    )

create table users (
        active boolean not null,
        must_change_password boolean not null,
        created_at timestamp(6) not null,
        id bigint generated by default as identity,
        updated_at timestamp(6),
        phone_number varchar(20),
        first_name varchar(50) not null,
        last_name varchar(50) not null,
        username varchar(50) not null unique,
        department varchar(100),
        job_title varchar(100),
        email varchar(255) not null unique,
        password varchar(255) not null,
        role enum ('IT_ADMIN','MANAGER','SUPER_ADMIN','USER') not null,
        primary key (id)
    )

create index idx_refresh_token_user 
       on refresh_tokens (user_id)

       add constraint FKbh3qpcc6um2ebd05n1y2iufgv
